tool_description: Accurate hyper-local weather forecasts, powered by our cutting-edge machine learning (ML) models. Historical weather, current weather, weather statistics , and hour-by-hour forecast - all weather data updated in real-time!
name: AI Weather by Meteosource
title: AI Weather by Meteosource

api_list.name: historical_weather
api_list.description: Receive **historical weather** data for a **given day** in the past **8 years**. Define your location using GPS coordinates or `place_id` from `Location endpoints`.

required_parameters.name: date
required_parameters.description: The UTC day of the data in the past in `YYYY-MM-DD` format.

optional_parameters.name: lat
optional_parameters.description: Latitude in format 12N, 12.3N, 12.3, or 13S, 13.2S, -13.4. **Alternatively, you can specify the location by parameter `place_id`.**

optional_parameters.name: place_id
optional_parameters.description: Identifier of a place. To obtain the `place_id` for the location you want, please use `Location endpoints`. **Alternatively, you can specify the location by parameters `lat` and `lon`.**

optional_parameters.name: units
optional_parameters.description:
Unit system to be used. The available values are:

- `auto`: Select the system automatically, based on the forecast location.
- `metric`: Metric (SI) units (`°C`, `mm/h`, `m/s`, `cm`, `km`, `hPa`).
- `us`: Imperial units (`°F`, `in/h`, `mph`, `in`, `mi`, `Hg`).
- `uk`: Same as `metric`, except that visibility is in `miles` and wind speeds are in `mph`.
- `ca`: Same as `metric`, except that wind speeds are in `km/h` and pressure is in `kPa`.

optional_parameters.name: lon
optional_parameters.description: Longitude in format 12E, 12.3E, 12.3, or 13W, 13.2W, -13.4. **Alternatively, you can specify the location by parameter `place_id`.**

api_list.name: weather_statistics
api_list.description: Get average weather: **long-term normals** for a given place for the next 30 days. Define your location using GPS coordinates or `place_id` from `Location endpoints`.

optional_parameters.name: units
optional_parameters.description:
Unit system to be used. The available values are:

- `auto`: Select the system automatically, based on the forecast location.
- `metric`: Metric (SI) units (`°C`, `mm/h`, `m/s`, `cm`, `km`, `hPa`).
- `us`: Imperial units (`°F`, `in/h`, `mph`, `in`, `mi`, `Hg`).
- `uk`: Same as `metric`, except that visibility is in `miles` and wind speeds are in `mph`.
- `ca`: Same as `metric`, except that wind speeds are in `km/h` and pressure is in `kPa`.

optional_parameters.name: place_id
optional_parameters.description: Identifier of a place. To obtain the `place_id` for the location you want, please use `Location endpoints`. **Alternatively, you can specify the location by parameters `lat` and `lon`.**

optional_parameters.name: lon
optional_parameters.description: Longitude in format 12E, 12.3E, 12.3, or 13W, 13.2W, -13.4. **Alternatively, you can specify the location by parameter `place_id`.**

optional_parameters.name: lat
optional_parameters.description: Latitude in format 12N, 12.3N, 12.3, or 13S, 13.2S, -13.4. **Alternatively, you can specify the location by parameter `place_id`.**

api_list.name: hourly
api_list.description: **Hourly weather** forecast for the next 5 days. **Global** data are based on our **AI technology**, which uses many different models. **Define your location** using GPS coordinates or `place_id` from `Location endpoints`.

optional_parameters.name: lon
optional_parameters.description: Longitude in format 12E, 12.3E, 12.3, or 13W, 13.2W, -13.4. **Alternatively, you can specify the location by parameter `place_id`.**

optional_parameters.name: lat
optional_parameters.description: Latitude in format 12N, 12.3N, 12.3, or 13S, 13.2S, -13.4. **Alternatively, you can specify the location by parameter `place_id`.**

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description:
The language of text summaries (variable names are never translated). Available languages are:

- `en`: English
- `es`: Spanish
- `fr`: French
- `de`: German
- `pl`: Polish
- `cs`: Czech

optional_parameters.name: place_id
optional_parameters.description: Identifier of a place. To obtain the `place_id` for the location you want, please use `Location endpoints`. **Alternatively, you can specify the location by parameters `lat` and `lon`.**

optional_parameters.name: units
optional_parameters.description:
Unit system to be used. The available values are:

- `auto`: Select the system automatically, based on the forecast location.
- `metric`: Metric (SI) units (`°C`, `mm/h`, `m/s`, `cm`, `km`, `hPa`).
- `us`: Imperial units (`°F`, `in/h`, `mph`, `in`, `mi`, `Hg`).
- `uk`: Same as `metric`, except that visibility is in `miles` and wind speeds are in `mph`.
- `ca`: Same as `metric`, except that wind speeds are in `km/h` and pressure is in `kPa`.

optional_parameters.name: timezone
optional_parameters.description: Timezone to be used for the date fields. If not specified, local timezone of the forecast location will be used. The format is according to the tzinfo database, so values like `Europe/Prague` or `UTC` can be used. Alternatively you may use the value `auto` in which case the local timezone of the location is used. The full list of valid timezone strings can be found [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones#List).

api_list.description: **Current weather** conditions based on weather stations around the world.  Updated every 10 minutes. **Define your location** using GPS coordinates or `place_id` from `Location endpoints`.

api_list.name: find_places
api_list.description:
**Search places by name** to get **place_id** for the `Weather Forecast Endpoints` and detailed **geographical information** (country, region, elevation, timezone, etc.) for a given location.

The response can contain multiple places, sorted by relevance. You can then identify the one you want by coordinates, country, region, or type.

Unlike the *find_places_prefix* endpoint, complete words are required here. You can search for cities, mountains, lakes, countries, etc.

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description:
The language the place names. Available languages are:

- `en`: English
- `es`: Spanish
- `fr`: French
- `de`: German
- `pl`: Polish
- `cs`: Czech

api_list.name: find_places_prefix
api_list.description:
**Search places by beginning of the name** to get **place_id** for the `Weather Forecast Endpoints` and detailed **geographical information** (country, region, elevation, timezone, etc.) for a given location.

The response can contain multiple places, sorted by relevance. You can then identify the one you want by coordinates, country, region, or type.

Unlike the *find_places* endpoint, you can specify only the prefix of the place you are looking for. You can search for cities, mountains, lakes, countries, etc.

required_parameters.name: text
required_parameters.description: Place name prefix to search for

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description:
The language the place names. Available languages are:

- `en`: English
- `es`: Spanish
- `fr`: French
- `de`: German
- `pl`: Polish
- `cs`: Czech

api_list.name: nearest_place
api_list.description:
Use this endpoint to search for the **nearest named place** (village/town/city) from a given GPS coordinates. You will get **place_id** for the `Weather Forecast Endpoints` and detailed **geographical information**.

*Note: If you specify coordinates of a secluded place (e.g. middle of the ocean), the nearest point can be very far from the coordinates.*

optional_parameters.name: language
optional_parameters.description:
The language the place names. Available languages are:

- `en`: English
- `es`: Spanish
- `fr`: French
- `de`: German
- `pl`: Polish
- `cs`: Czech

api_list.name: astro
api_list.description: Returns global **Sun and Moon information** (sunrise/sunset, moonrise/moonset and moon phase) for the next 30 days. Define your location using GPS coordinates or `place_id` from `Location endpoints`.

optional_parameters.name: lon
optional_parameters.description: Longitude in format 12E, 12.3E, 12.3, or 13W, 13.2W, -13.4. **Alternatively, you can specify the location by parameter `place_id`.**

optional_parameters.name: place_id
optional_parameters.description: Identifier of a place. To obtain the `place_id` for the location you want, please use `Location endpoints`. **Alternatively, you can specify the location by parameters `lat` and `lon`.**

The format is according to the tzinfo database, so values like `Europe/Prague` or `UTC` can be used. Alternatively you may use the value `auto` in which case the local timezone of the location is used. The full list of valid timezone strings can be found [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones#List).
